DOC.brief_summary: A noninferiority randomize controlled trial aim compare effect safety electroacupuncture versus pelvic floor muscle training ( PFMT ) plus solifenacin mixed urinary incontinence ( MUI ) .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Electroacupuncture Versus PFMT Plus Solifenacin Mixed Urinary Incontinence
DOC.detailed_description: Participants experience mixed urinary incontinence recruit 10 center . A gynecologist urologist make diagnosis . Central randomization perform Clinical Evaluation Center China Academy Chinese Medical Sciences Beijing . Sample size : Sample size base primary outcome . According literature , investigator predict MUI patient 's average 72-h incontinence episode frequency week 1-12 decrease 60 % baseline treatment PFMT plus solifenacin . The number acupuncture group 57 % . For assessment noninferiority , 250 participant need group allow 15 % dropout ( α=0.05，β=0.2，δ=15 % ) . Quality control : A 3-level monitoring system ( monitor responsible one center , monitor responsible center monitor responsible whole trial ) establish check performance trial time . Outcome assessment , completion case report form data management strict supervision . Data management : The Remote Dara Capture ( RDC ) system use data enter . Both paper electronic case report form reserve . A data verification plan make .
